content.description: The graph above shows <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>C</mi><mi>O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> measurements taken from Mauna Loa, Hawaii, and the Vostok ice core, which was drilled from ice sheets in Antarctica.
content.question: Based on the data shown in the graph, which of the following is the most plausible hypothesis about the number of glacial periods that occurred in the past 400,000 years?

choices.label: One glacial period occurred in the past 400,000 years.
Two glacial periods occurred in the past 400,000 years.
Three glacial periods occurred in the past 400,000 years.
Four glacial periods occurred in the past 400,000 years.

content.answer: Four glacial periods occurred in the past 400,000 years.

skill.text: Skill 5.D: Interpret experimental data and results in relation to a given hypothesis.
